TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , presently resides in GPE , GPE . In his application form , he states that he has NORP nationality .

On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE and requested asylum . He stated that he is an ethnic NORP from PERSON in GPE . DATE and DATE he served in a NORP infantry unit and was involved in many battles in GPE . In DATE he refused to comply with an order for active duty and was put in a military prison for DATE . Upon release , he was ordered to report to his unit but , instead , he fled to GPE where he obtained a passport with which he travelled to GPE . He claimed that , if returned to GPE , he would be put in prison or sent to the front - line .

On DATE ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) rejected the applicant ’s request and ordered his deportation to GPE . Finding that the applicant held both NORP and NORP citizenship , the ORG referred to a decision concerning asylum seekers with such double nationality taken by ORG on DATE . According to the decision , the prevailing situation in GPE rendered deportations to that country impossible . Consequently , in assessing applications from these asylum seekers , the crucial question was whether they could be afforded protection in GPE . ORG noted that , according to available information , persons in the applicant ’s situation did not risk to be sent from GPE to GPE against their will . Moreover , no acts of warfare had taken place on NORP territory for some time and a cease - fire had been agreed upon by the contending parties . Thus , there was no apparent risk that NORP citizens in general would be forced to take part in armed conflict . Further , the applicant had failed to show that he personally faced such a risk .
The applicant appealed to ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) . On DATE ORG , sharing the opinion of ORG , rejected the appeal .

The applicant later requested a temporary residence permit in GPE . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG granted the applicant such a permit until DATE and quashed the deportation order . In so doing , the ORG referred to a Government decision of CARDINAL DATE according to which the worsened situation in GPE constituted an impediment to the deportation of asylum seekers to that country .

On DATE the applicant submitted a new application for a residence permit . He referred to his previous statements . Further , at an oral hearing held by ORG on DATE he claimed that he could not return to GPE , as he would not receive any help and would have great difficulties in supporting himself . Consequently , if returned to that country , he would be forced to go back to PERSON where he would be punished for having evaded military service . Further , as the most extreme NORP lived in his home district in GPE , he would be at risk due to the evasion and the fact that he had applied for asylum in a foreign country . He submitted a document showing that he was wanted for draft evasion by the military authorities of ORG . The applicant referred also to the time he had spent in GPE and claimed that he had adjusted himself to NORP society .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s new application and ordered his deportation to GPE . ORG had regard to guiding decisions taken by ORG and found that the applicant should not be sent back to PERSON . With regard to the possible deportation to GPE , the ORG noted that no new circumstances had been invoked by the applicant . Consequently , ORG reiterated the conclusions drawn in the previous decisions concerning the applicant . Furthermore , ORG found that there were no reasons of a humanitarian nature to grant the applicant a residence permit .
The applicant ’s appeal against ORG decision is still pending before ORG .

In a medical certificate issued at a psychiatric clinic in GPE on DATE chief physician P.R. stated that the applicant showed signs of depression , powerlessness and insomnia as a result of having spent DATE in refugee camps in GPE . However , the applicant refused to take medication as he did not consider that he was suffering from any serious illness .
